title: Antony Blinken Defends Afghanistan Withdrawal, Citing Trump's Deal
summary: Secretary of state says 20 years in Afghanistan shows that using force to remake a country 'is beyond our means and capacity'. The chief U.S. diplomat on Monday defended the military withdrawal from Afghanistan, telling a House committee that the Biden administration was bound to former President Donald Trump's agreement with the Taliban and that remaining would have risked more American lives.

title: Jeb Bush's Finback Investment Partners Closes Debut Fund
summary: The former Florida governor's firm amassed $350 million to back companies alongside other private-equity investors. Finback Investment Partners LLC, a private-equity firm co-founded by former Florida Gov. Jeb Bush, has closed on $350 million for its debut fund.

title: A Theranos Timeline: The Downfall of Elizabeth Holmes
summary: The rise and fall of the blood-testing startup founder has played out over 18 years. 2003 - Elizabeth Holmes, then 19 years old, drops out of Stanford University and launches what will become blood-testing startup Theranos Inc.

title: Democrats Release Details of Proposed Tax Increase
summary: Lawmakers plan to vote this week in the House Ways and Means Committee on the proposals. House Democrats spelled out their proposed tax increases on Monday, pushing higher rates on corporations, investors and high-income business owners as they try to piece together enough votes for legislation to expand the social safety net and combat climate change.

title: Here Comes the Biden Tax Bill
summary: Pelosi marches House Democrats to the political gallows.. It's been under wraps longer than some Egyptian mummies, but the bill for the Joe Biden-Nancy Pelosi-Bernie Sanders spending agenda is about to be exposed to the air. The Ways and Means Committee draft tax increase that leaked over the weekend is a $2.2 trillion Washington money grab for the ages.

title: Iran's Dangerous Nuclear Dance
summary: Will anything stop Biden from trying to revive the flawed deal?. We're not sure Iran could do anything to make President Biden give up his pursuit of reviving the 2015 nuclear deal, and Iran is acting as if it agrees. This could explain Tehran's escalations in response to U.S. concessions.

title: Where the Covid Origin Inquiry Goes Now
summary: Congress can focus on U.S. funding for gain-of-function research.. After the intelligence community submitted its muddled report last month on the origins of Covid-19, President Biden said "the world deserves answers, and I will not rest until we get them." He won't get answers from China, but that doesn't mean the U.S. can't do more at home.

title: Family Farms Won't Escape Biden's New Tax
summary: The president thinks they haven't paid their 'fair share.'. Agriculture Secretary Tom Vilsack, the former Democratic governor of Iowa, writes that "Biden's Tax Changes Won't Hurt Family Farmers" or small-business owners (op-ed, Sept. 9). Maybe he has been in Washington too long, as he has lost his grasp of today's capital-intensive, high-risk farming economics in Iowa.

title: $300 a Week and the Persistent Jobs Problem
summary: The government-sanctioned free housing (aka eviction moratorium) has been a more significant disincentive to work.. Regarding "The Biden Jobs Paradox" (Review & Outlook, Sept. 4): More than eight million renters self-report as behind on rent. While the extra $300 a week in enhanced unemployment benefits has been a disincentive to work, a more significant disincentive has been the government-sanctioned free housing (aka eviction moratorium) paid for by property owners.

title: Cuba's Old Republic Outshines Colonialism and Castroism
summary: The island's democratic period (1902-1952) saw impressive achievements.. Felipe Fernández-Armesto's review of "Cuba: An American History" by Ada Ferrer (Bookshelf, Sept. 4) offers insights into Cuba's history under colonialism and Castroism, but it does a disservice to Cuba's democratic period (1902-1952). During the Cuban Republic, the island's leaders negotiated the return of the Isle of Pines and reduced the U.S. military presence from four bases to two and then to one. The Platt Amendment was the price for ending the four-year American occupation following the Spanish-American War, and ending Platt in 1934 ended formal U.S. interference in Cuban affairs.

title: Religious Liberty, the State and the Yeshivas
summary: Defenders of freedom should pay close attention.. Regarding Dovid Margolin's "Communism, Secularism and Jewish Schools" (Houses of Worship, Sept. 3): The yeshiva controversy is not merely a matter for Haredi Jews. When the Ku Klux Klan successfully lobbied to ban private (read: Catholic) schools in Oregon in 1922, a group of nuns who ran schools filed suit. In Pierce v. Society of Sisters (1925), a unanimous Supreme Court struck down the ban, holding that "the child is not the mere creature of the state."

title: Timothée Chalamet, Rihanna, Billie Eilish and the 41 Best Looks of the Met Gala 2021
summary: Fashion's biggest night finally returned-with a dose of national pride-at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. See all the most notable looks from the red carpet.. It's not the first Monday in May-but what are calendar technicalities when it comes to the Metropolitan Museum of Art's first Costume Institute gala since 2019? Condé Nast chief content officer and global Vogue chief Anna Wintour presided over the red carpet in her custom Oscar de la Renta gown, playing host with official event co-chairs Timothée Chalamet, Billie Eilish, Amanda Gorman and Naomi Osaka (and alongside her fellow honorary co-chairs, designer Tom Ford and Instagram's Adam Mosseri). The theme and dress code of the event was "American Independence," which ties into the Met's accompanying show, In America: A Lexicon of Fashion. Scroll to see the most electric and exciting fashion looks from the evening, from Chalamet in Haider Ackermann to Gorman in Vera Wang.

title: A Cricket Ban Won't Hurt the Taliban
summary: Boycotting the national team would only punish ordinary Afghans.. Eight days after a suicide bomber slaughtered scores of people at Kabul airport, the Taliban allowed a cricket match to be played in the Afghan capital. Players were drawn from among the best Afghan cricketers. Some 4,000 spectators attended-each patted down at the gates by Taliban guards. The enthusiastic but prudent crowd waved both the flag of Afghanistan and the banner of the Taliban. No women were present.

title: 'To Rule the Waves' Review: The Necessity of a Navy
summary: The imperative of protecting trade lanes on the high seas is fueling maritime competition, especially between the U.S. and China.. Even for those transfixed by grand strategy, Alfred Thayer Mahan's "The Influence of Seapower Upon History" (1890) is a slog. In more than 500 pages of often turgid prose, Mahan, who twice served as president of the U.S. Naval War College, examined how maritime strength shaped war between 1660 and 1783. "The necessity of a navy," he wrote, "springs . . . from the existence of a peaceful shipping." He concluded that a large merchant fleet and a strong navy with bases allowing it to operate far from home were vital to protect the U.S. economy and maintain foreign trade in times of war. "In order to do this," he added, "the enemy must be kept not only out of our ports, but far away from our coasts."

title: Gavin Newsom's White Privilege
summary: Instead of debating ideas, progressives call Larry Elder a white supremacist.. If the polls going into Tuesday's recall election in California hold up, Gavin Newsom will keep his job as governor. But if he does, no one should ever again take seriously progressive complaints about white privilege.

title: American Global Leadership Is in Retreat
summary: If the U.S.-led liberal international order is crumbling, what comes next?. The 20th anniversary of 9/11 finds American foreign policy in a peculiar place. The U.S. hasn't stabilized the Middle East, permanently remade Afghan society or ended jihad. But no terrorist has managed to inflict another attack on the scale of Sept. 11 on the American homeland. As a result, the War on Terror has receded to the margins of U.S. politics as fears that the liberal world order is crumbling rise to the fore.

title: Intuit Agrees to Buy Mailchimp for About $12 Billion
summary: The deal for the closely held company would be TurboTax maker's largest ever. TurboTax maker Intuit Inc. agreed to buy email-marketing pioneer Mailchimp for about $12 billion, in a move aimed at capitalizing on the growth of small and midsize businesses.

summary: White House taps Rostin Behnam as permanent chairman and plans to nominate two commissioners, giving Democrats a 3-1 majority at the derivatives regulator. title: When Politicians Talk About Infrastructure
summary: Let's hope 'progressive' threats to reject $1 trillion in spending are sincere.. But don't sell the infrastructure plan short-it too is a tremendous slouch.

title: Prince Andrew Faces Court Test in Effort to Block Sex-Abuse Suit
summary: Federal judge weighs whether Virginia Giuffre's lawyers have given British royal proper notice of legal accusations. Lawyers involved in a lawsuit accusing the U.K.'s Prince Andrew of sexual abuse sparred at a hearing Monday over an obscure but crucial legal question: whether the royal had been given proper notice about the complaint.

summary: China's companies must allow their audit firms to be audited or their shares won't trade in U.S. capital markets.. title: A Four-Day Workweek Is No Holiday
summary: For most parents with young children, shorter-not fewer-workdays is a better deal.. title: First Trial in Varsity Blues Case Gets Under Way
summary: Prosecutors called Bruce Isackson, a California parent who pleaded guilty, as first witness. title: New York City Public Schools Reopen Amid Covid-19 with No Remote Learning Option
summary: Resume Subscription. The price of litecoin, a little-used cryptocurrency, spiked in early trading Monday before falling back, after a news release touting a partnership with giant retailer Walmart Inc. turned out to be fake.

title: Shortage of School Bus Drivers Prompts Massachusetts to Tap National Guard
summary: School districts across the U.S. are looking for ways to address a lack of drivers. Massachusetts Gov. Charlie Baker is enlisting the National Guard to help transport students to school as the state manages a bus driver shortage at the start of the 2021-22 school year.

title: Inflation Expectations Continue to Climb, New York Fed Survey Shows
summary: Respondents see inflation at 5.2% a year from now and 4% in three years, while expected income also rises. title: 'Once Upon a Time in Queens' Review: Meet the Mets
summary: A four-part '30 for 30' presentation on ESPN tells the amazin' story of the 1986 Mets.. The more storied seasons of Major League Baseball-not plays, not games, but entire seasons-unfold like 19th-century novels, or the more implausible of Hollywood fantasies. The '78 Yankees. The '79 Pirates. The 2002 Oakland A's (who were, in fact, the basis of "Moneyball") or the '86 New York Mets-the subject of "Once Upon a Time in Queens," a foul-mouthed fairy tale about what is probably best remembered as a tale of soaring stars and collapsing Red Sox.

summary: Washington's attorney general added new allegations to a pending antitrust lawsuit, which Amazon is fighting. Police Monitors to Come Under New Limits in U.S.
summary: Justice Department to cap budgets, tenure of teams overseeing local law-enforcement revisions. summary: Cartel raises forecast for 2022, citing travel rebound. title: Proenza Schouler, Tom Ford, and The 17 Best Looks of New York Fashion Week
summary: New York Fashion Week made its cautious return-but on the runway, designs looked boldly and fearlessly ahead. The most stylish ensembles to know.. "[N]ewfound freedoms, however fragile they seem," Proenza Schouler designers Jack McCollough and Lazaro Hernandez said Wednesday in the notes of their collection, "[are] coupled with an absolute optimism for all that lies ahead."

title: Iran Says It Will Resume Nuclear Talks in the Near Future
summary: Iranian pledge comes as Washington suspends plan to rebuke Tehran over failure to cooperate with U.N. atomic agency. title: U.N. Gets $1 Billion for Afghan Relief as Taliban Promise Access for Aid
summary: Taliban commit to respect rights of women, minorities and freedom of expression 'in light of religion'. title: Realtor Group Seeks to Block Justice Department Investigation
summary: NAR files petition to block investigation of industry practices, saying DOJ's withdrawal from earlier settlement is breach of law. title: Top Tips From TV's Funniest Cook, 'Master of None' Co-Star Eric Wareheim
summary: With his new cookbook, the comedian and actor is flexing his culinary chops, serving up sexy leftovers and offering wine pairings, to boot. WORKING IN TV doesn't necessarily make for the best eating, what with long days and nights spent shooting and the inevitable desperate plunges into the candy bowl on the craft service table. But in the case of comedian-actor-writer-director-musician Eric Wareheim, the work only served to further his evolution into a full-fledged cook, restaurant hound and wine connoisseur. "Being on tour or shooting around the world, I was always looking for where I could get the best meal, whether going to Chicago and having a deep-dish pizza or being in Miami and eating ceviche," he said. Shooting the second season of Netflix 's "Master of None," for example, he and the show's creator, his friend and fellow comedian Aziz Ansari, learned how to make pasta with Italian grandmothers-on camera and off. "It became an obsession that went beyond just TV," he said.

title: Fringe Dating Apps Deserve More Bantr
summary: Lesser-used dating apps might not be worth your money today, but they are definitely worth your time. Ted Lasso is quite the eligible bachelor, but he isn't on Tinder, Bumble or Hinge. title: Covid Confusion at the CDC
summary: Decisions on boosters relied on data from Israel. Why isn't the U.S. producing this research?. The U.S. spends lavishly on healthcare yet can't answer basic questions about Covid-19. But the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has failed to provide the information needed to inform a sound Covid strategy.

title: Covid-19 Study in England Shows Few Deaths Among Vaccinated

LONDON-An analysis of more than 50,000 Covid-19 deaths in England this year offers reassuring evidence on the effectiveness of vaccines, showing that mortality rates among people fully inoculated against coronavirus were a fraction of those without a shot.

title: He Acted in More Than 20 Movies. Now the T-Shirts He Made on the Side Are Worth Thousands.
summary: The late actor Stanley DeSantis, who appeared in 'The Aviator,' 'Entourage' and 'Alf,' also managed to operate a massive business producing memorabilia T-shirts, many of which are still coveted today. On Instagram, nearly 10,000 posts are labeled with the hashtag #StanleyDeSantis. DeSantis, who died in 2005, was a prolific actor, appearing in everything from the hammy '80s sitcom "Alf" to the 1996 camp classic film "The Birdcage" to the 2000s HBO bro-fest "Entourage." But barely any of the Instagram posts concern DeSantis's screen success. Almost all are related to his other career: as a T-shirt designer and manufacturer who specialized in officially licensing designs based on movies and TV shows. Over a decade after his death, DeSantis's graphic tees have become gobsmackingly collectible.

title: After Covid-19 Data Is Deleted, NIH Reviews Gene Archive's Handling

title: The Struggle to Reverse a Shrinking Population Hits Some Nations Harder

title: Antoni Porowski on the Sleeping Advice He Got from Justin Trudeau
summary: The 'Queer Eye' star also shares his go-to breakfast and intensive exercise routine.. On Mondays, Queer Eye star Antoni Porowski usually wakes up between 6:30 and 7:15 a.m. In his pre-pandemic life, he used to pour himself a black cold brew from La Colombe first thing. These days, his dog, a rescue pitbull mix named Neon, demands his attention. "I have to take her out to pee and then I have to feed her immediately because she literally runs around the living room until she gets fed," says Porowski, 37, "and then I can have my coffee." Porowski's caffeine routine progresses as the week goes on; by midweek, he allows himself the indulgence of nondairy milk, his current go-to being Táche pistachio milk. "I used a lot of oat milk but then I heard they put a lot of vegetable oils in there and then I heard almond milk is terrible for the environment, so I was like, oh God, what am I going to do?" he says. "Pistachio milk is the perfect balance of salty and sweet."

summary: Heavy reliance on wind power, coupled with a shortage of natural gas, has led to a spike in energy prices. Natural gas and electricity markets were already surging in Europe when a fresh catalyst emerged: The wind in the stormy North Sea stopped blowing.

title: The Tech Crackdown Bites Korea Inc.
summary: Traumatized tech investors shouldn't let the drama in Beijing blind them to developments elsewhere. Korean regulators-and politicians-are sending signals of displeasure.. Investors are selling technology stocks in a major Asian economy on regulatory worries just as one of the country's biggest online payment companies is about to go public. China? No, it's South Korea.

title: This Milwaukee Man Runs Up 77 Flights of Stairs at 4 a.m.
summary: Resume Subscription. When Reid Tileston moved from San Francisco to Milwaukee in 2019, he didn't care about finding an apartment with a pool or a view. He was looking for a building with a lot of stairs. Mr. Tileston, 37 years old, now lives in one the city's tallest residential towers and runs its 77 flights of stairs twice a day.

title: Green Steel Becomes a Hot Commodity for Auto Makers
summary: Resume Subscription. BERLIN-Auto makers are racing to find cleaner steel to build their cars.

title: Discontent Simmers Over How to Police EU Privacy Rules
summary: Delay in WhatsApp fine highlights some EU regulators' dissatisfaction with GDPR enforcement. The European Union's recent $270 million fine against WhatsApp was held up for months by disagreements among national authorities, ratcheting up tensions over how to enforce the bloc's privacy rules.

title: Big Banks Often Look Inside When Hiring CFOs
summary: Bank of America is one of several large banks that have recently promoted company veterans to the chief financial officer role. Large U.S. banks typically choose a company veteran when they hire a chief financial officer, a pattern highlighted Friday when Bank of America Corp. named a new CFO.

title: White House Works to Keep Moderate Democrats' Backing
summary: Republicans say Biden's proposals for trillions in spending will drive up prices; the administration contends the plans would help the economy in the long term. WASHINGTON-With negotiations over a $3.5 trillion budget bill heating up among Democrats, the White House is trying to ensure that inflation fears don't drive moderates away from supporting the plan as Republicans argue the proposal will accelerate a surge in prices.

title: Live Nation Plans to Acquire OCESA in Move Into Latin America
summary: The world's largest live-entertainment company has revived a pandemic-hit deal to pay about $450 million for a majority stake in the Mexican concert promoter. Live Nation Entertainment Inc. has reached a new agreement to acquire Mexican concert promoter OCESA Entretenimiento for about $450 million.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: The Numbers on Work in the Covid-19 Era
summary: Job frustrations, work-safety worries, delayed office reopenings-this isn't the post-pandemic season we were hoping for. This month was supposed to mark the triumphant return to the office, to business travel, to non-wobbly child care and a postwork happy hour or two.

title: Hold Your Horses! (Monday Crossword, September 13)
TransUnion Nears $3.1 Billion Deal for Neustar
summary: Purchase of the information-services company could help TransUnion diversify beyond its core credit-reporting business. TransUnion is nearing a deal to buy information-services company Neustar Inc. for $3.1 billion, according to people familiar with the matter, a move that could help the consumer-credit reporting giant diversify beyond its core business and put data to new uses.

title: The Stock Market Fails a Breathalyzer
summary: Beyond Meat, with pea protein, is worth more than the global market for peas.. Joby Aviation, which plans to begin an electric air taxi service in 2024, is worth more than Lufthansa , EasyJet or JetBlue . Does that seem right? In this market, why not? Heck, earlier this year, Tesla was worth more than the next nine car manufacturers combined, though now only the next six. Beyond Meat, made with pea protein, is worth more than the entire market for peas eaten globally-like the bumper sticker says: Imagine whirled peas. Do fundamentals even matter?

title: Surprise! Daniil Medvedev Slams the Door on Novak Djokovic
summary: With history on the verge, the 25-year-old Russian steamrolls his way to the U.S. Open championship. Novak Djokovic got Novak Djokovic'd. Is there any other way to put it? Here he was, the most brilliant spoiler of tennis spoilers, the World No. 1 who'd made a career out of crushing pretty story lines and repeatedly breaking the hearts of beloved crowd favorites-except this time, it was Djokovic who was the beloved crowd favorite, a pretty story line on the doorstep of tennis history...and it was his heart being broken.

title: ViacomCBS to Restructure Paramount Pictures
summary: TV veteran David Nevins will oversee Paramount TV in new alignment. ViacomCBS Inc. is revamping the operations of its Paramount Pictures movie and television production unit as part of a broader shake-up of the management there that will give television veteran David Nevins a larger role, people familiar with the matter said.
